parse.title: "I Can't Carry It for You... but I Can Carry You."

links.*: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (extended edition)

wikitext.*:
{{Stub}}
'''"I Can't Carry It for You... but I Can Carry You."''' is the fifty-first scene of ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King]]'' and the sixty-sixth scene of [[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (extended edition)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King'' (extended edition)]]. 

In this scene, [[Frodo]] and [[Sam]] are struggling up [[Mount Doom]] when Frodo collapses, unable to go any further. Sam then proceeds to carry him up the mountain, professing that while he cannot carry the [[Ring]], he can carry the Ring-bearer, hence the quote: "I can't carry it for you, but I can carry you." 

[[Category:The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King scenes|66]]
